channel.title: How Do I Make A Fun PK Zone?
channel.description: I Would Like To Know How To Make A PK Area, But Make It Where People Don't Lose Their Stuff. If Anyone Can Help Me I Would Appreciate It.

Giving him the full code gives him a chance to understand it, that’s why i posted it all.[/quote]

how will they understand it when you post it the way you did where you explained nothing what so ever

explain that one to me

item.title: How Do I Make A Fun PK Zone?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Ha, i made a tutorial for this on my website, I’ll C&P it.
Difficulty 5.5/10, depending on knowledge.
Classes modified : Client.java.
Steps involved :
What this does: Simply makes a area where if you die, you loose no items.

Method
1.At the top of client.java you’ll see this;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

Under that add this:

public boolean noItemLoss() { if(absX >= #### && absX <= #### && #### >= 4813 && #### <= 4857) return true; else return false; }
Where the #'s are you’ll need to add some coordinates.
To make this simpler, look at it like this:

public boolean noItemLoss() { if(absX >= southWestCornerXcoord && absX <= northEastCorneXcoord && absY >= southWestCornerYcoord && absY <= northEastCornerYcoord) return true; else return false; }
Now fill in the ####'s using my simplified way.
2. Search for:

public void youdied()

The whole code should look like this:

[CODE]public void youdied() {
for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];

            if ((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }
    for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
        try {
            if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
                // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
                ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
                        playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
                // createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
                deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
                        getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]); 
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {}
    }
    removeAllItems();
    for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) {
        try {
            int item = playerEquipment[r];

            if ((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }
    for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
        try {
            if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
                // createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
                ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
                        playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
                // createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
                deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
                        getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]); 
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {}
    }
    removeAllItems();
    teleportToX = 2512;
    teleportToY = 3863;
    // pEmote = 15;
    // pWalk = 13;
    sendMessage("OH EM GEE YOU DIED!");
    hitDiff = 0;	
    updateRequired = true;
    appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

}
}[/CODE]
Under:

 public void youdied() {

Add:

if(noItemLoss()) { teleportToX = 2535; teleportToY = 4836; heightLevel = 0; //pEmote = 15; //pWalk = 13; sendMessage("Oh dear you died!"); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(!loseNoItems()) {
Now, underneath the last bracket of the whole void, add :

}

Now save and compile your server. You now have a fun PKing area.
[b]Credits: 100% Jordie.
There -.-.
